availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, physician. Son of Mary Calwell Breckinridge Satterwhite. Married to Maria P.P. Rogers Satterwhite in Louisville, Kentucky on January 14, 1858. Father of Lilly R. Satterwhite and Thomas P. Satterwhite. Student in Fayette County, Kentucky in 1850. Physician in Louisville, Kentucky in 1860. Employed Margaret Smith as a domestic in Louisville in 1860. Owned one enslaved individual in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 225A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 5, p. 138.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, p. 17.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 5, p. 546A.
Find A Grave, "Dr. Thomas Palmer Satterwhite (July 21, 1835-June 3, 1917)," Memorial #6589268, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6589268 (accessed May 2, 2020).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000482708 , p. 58.
"Death Claims Noted Doctor,"Courier-Journal(Louisville, Ky.), June 4, 1917, p. 1-2.
